botanical_details.genus: Ribes can be deciduous or evergreen shrubs, sometimes spiny, with simple, usually palmately lobed leaves and small tubular or bell-shaped, solitary or racemose flowers borne in spring or summer, followed by juicy, sometimes edible berries

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in a well-drained, fertile soil with a neutral to slightly acid pH. Full sun is preferred, but partial shade is tolerated and plants can be trained against a north wall. Grow as a permanent framework as a bush, standard, cordon or fan. Keep the around the bushes free of other plants. Keep the area around the bushes free of other plants. Mulch with well-rotted compost, manure or bark particularly on dry soils. Further redcurrant cultivation advice
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by hardwood cuttings in autumn
how_to_grow.pruning: Main pruning is carried out in dormant season, along with summer pruning of vigorous laterals
how_to_grow.pests: Maybe susceptible to aphids, including redcurrant blister aphid, scale insects and gooseberry sawflies. Berries are very attractive to birds
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to Powdery mildews
